title: Drawing, "Tequendama Falls near Bogotá, Colombia", 1853
medium: Pencil and white gouache on creamy paper
description: The Falls are obliquely shown in the central middle distance.  Figures are inscribed, and:  "rock".  Written right bottom:  "2 Beautiful effect of spring from / Tequendama falls over the rock which is sloped / with tender green / 3 yellow light - the remainder of the / rock in the chasm is dark brown, to the right / rich with ochrous colors / 4 water - rapid / 5 macaw on rock at the right / Beautiful effect".  A bird is shown at the right back, out of scale.  A man drawn in children's manner stands at the left bank.  The dog's head is shown in front; beside is a rough sketch of a crouching cat.  Bottom, reverse:  three sketchy designs, each with added "rock."

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Tequendama Falls near Bogotá, Colombia", 1853.
1853. Pencil and white gouache on creamy paper. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-265.
